definition: Federal agency ensuring safe and healthy working conditions.
example_usage: OSHA regulations require proper handling of biohazards.

full_form: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
definition: Federal agency that protects public health and safety.
example_usage: The CDC issued new vaccination guidelines.

definition: Federal agency responsible for protecting public health by regulating food drugs and medical devices.
example_usage: The FDA approved the new medication.

definition: International organization directing global health matters.
example_usage: The WHO declared a public health emergency.

definition: Federal agency conducting and supporting medical research.
example_usage: The study was funded by the NIH.

definition: Organization focused on reducing cardiovascular disease and stroke.
example_usage: The AHA recommends CPR training for all.

full_form: Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations
definition: Organization that accredits healthcare facilities.
example_usage: The hospital is preparing for JCAHO inspection.

definition: Advanced training for healthcare providers in cardiac emergency care.
example_usage: All ICU nurses must be ACLS certified.

definition: Fundamental emergency care including CPR and AED use.
example_usage: BLS certification is required for all clinical staff.

definition: Advanced training for managing critically ill infants and children.
example_usage: PALS certification is mandatory for pediatric nurses.

definition: Specialized unit caring for premature and critically ill newborns.
example_usage: The premature infant was admitted to the NICU.

definition: Specialized unit caring for critically ill children.
example_usage: The child with severe asthma was transferred to PICU.

definition: ICU specializing in post-operative critical care.
example_usage: The patient recovered in SICU after major surgery.

definition: ICU for medically complex patients.
example_usage: The patient with sepsis was admitted to MICU.

definition: Antibiotic-resistant bacterial infection.
example_usage: The patient was isolated due to MRSA.

definition: Antibiotic-resistant bacterial infection.
example_usage: Contact precautions were implemented for VRE.

definition: Bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea.
example_usage: The patient developed CDIFF after antibiotic use.

definition: Enzyme produced by bacteria causing antibiotic resistance.
example_usage: ESBL-producing bacteria require specific antibiotics.

definition: Advanced stage of HIV infection.
example_usage: The patient was diagnosed with AIDS.

definition: Viral respiratory illness.
example_usage: SARS outbreak occurred in 2003.

definition: Severe lung condition causing breathing failure.
example_usage: The patient developed ARDS from pneumonia.

definition: Unexplained death of an infant under one year.
example_usage: Safe sleep practices reduce SIDS risk.

definition: Progressive neurodegenerative disease affecting motor neurons.
example_usage: ALS leads to muscle weakness and atrophy.

definition: Disease of the heart's blood vessels.
example_usage: CHD is a leading cause of death.

definition: Infection of the upper airways.
example_usage: URI symptoms include congestion and sore throat.

definition: Surgical procedure to remove prostate tissue.
example_usage: TURP is performed to treat BPH.

definition: Open-heart surgery to improve blood flow to the heart.
example_usage: The patient underwent CABG surgery.

definition: Procedure to open blocked coronary arteries.
example_usage: PTCA restored blood flow to the heart.

definition: Non-surgical procedure to open blocked coronary arteries.
example_usage: PCI involves inserting a stent.

definition: Endoscopic examination of upper digestive tract.
example_usage: EGD can diagnose ulcers and bleeding.

definition: Procedure to diagnose and treat bile duct problems.
example_usage: ERCP can remove gallstones from bile ducts.

definition: Electronic system for entering medical orders.
example_usage: CPOE reduces medication errors.

definition: System for storing and accessing medical images.
example_usage: PACS allows radiologists to view images remotely.

definition: Unique identification number for healthcare providers.
example_usage: Each physician must have an NPI number.

definition: Standardized system for diagnostic codes.
example_usage: ICD-10 codes are used for billing.

definition: Process of ensuring healthcare meets quality standards.
example_usage: QA reviews improve patient safety.

definition: Systematic approach to improving healthcare processes.
example_usage: The QI team reduced hospital infections.

definition: Document tracking all medications given to a patient.
example_usage: Nurses document all doses on the MAR.

definition: Method of recording patient information by problem.
example_usage: POMR organizes complex patient histories.

definition: Portable device that checks heart rhythm and delivers shock.
example_usage: AEDs are available in public spaces.

definition: Mechanical pump supporting heart function.
example_usage: LVAD serves as bridge to transplant.

definition: Device delivering constant air pressure for sleep apnea.
example_usage: CPAP therapy improves sleep quality.

definition: Device delivering two levels of air pressure for breathing support.
example_usage: BiPAP is used for respiratory failure.

definition: Pressure in lungs at end of expiration during mechanical ventilation.
example_usage: PEEP prevents alveolar collapse.

definition: Percentage of oxygen in air being breathed.
example_usage: Room air has FiO2 of 21%.

definition: Test measuring blood oxygen carbon dioxide and pH.
example_usage: ABG results guide respiratory management.

definition: Blood test measuring clotting time.
example_usage: INR monitoring is essential for warfarin therapy.

definition: Blood test measuring clotting time.
example_usage: PTT monitors heparin therapy.

definition: Blood test measuring blood clotting time.
example_usage: PT is elevated in liver disease.

definition: Blood test measuring inflammation.
example_usage: Elevated ESR suggests inflammatory process.

definition: Blood test measuring inflammation.
example_usage: CRP is elevated in infection and inflammation.

definition: Blood test measuring heart failure severity.
example_usage: Elevated BNP indicates heart failure.

definition: Blood test screening for prostate cancer.
example_usage: Annual PSA testing for men over 50.

definition: Blood test measuring thyroid function.
example_usage: Abnormal TSH indicates thyroid disorder.

definition: Blood test measuring average glucose over 3 months.
example_usage: HbA1c monitors diabetes control.

definition: Bad cholesterol that increases heart disease risk.
example_usage: High LDL requires lifestyle changes.

definition: Good cholesterol that protects against heart disease.
example_usage: High HDL is protective.

definition: Type of cholesterol carrying triglycerides.
example_usage: Elevated VLDL increases cardiovascular risk.

definition: Blood tests assessing liver health.
example_usage: Abnormal LFTs suggest liver disease.

definition: Blood test measuring electrolytes and kidney function.
example_usage: BMP includes glucose sodium potassium and creatinine.

definition: Expanded blood test including liver and kidney function.
example_usage: CMP includes all BMP tests plus liver enzymes.

definition: Blood test measuring blood cell components.
example_usage: CBC screens for anemia and infection.
